div.a: The Lonely Existence Of Mel Feit, Men's Rights Advocate

div.div: For decades, he has tried to expose the ways society discriminates against men. Will feminists ever see him as anything but an enemy?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W1BJrL&via=Digg&text=The Lonely Existence Of Mel Feit, Men's Rights Advocate

div.a: J.J. Abrams Reportedly Set To Direct Next 'Star Wars' Film

div.div: J.J. Abrams will direct the next "Star Wars" film for Disney, taking stewardship of one of Hollywood's most iconic and lucrative film franchises, an individual with knowledge of the production told TheWrap.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VaeKHS&via=Digg&text=J.J. Abrams Reportedly Set To Direct Next 'Star Wars' Film

div.a: The Real Cost of College Vs. College Spending Per Student

div.div: You would think that schools that charge the most tuition would cost the most for all students and spending the most per students. Instead, richer schools tend to charge higher tuitions, which are paid fully by some students, but they also have more money to reduce the sticker price for low-income applicants.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14e86Gk&via=Digg&text=The Real Cost of College Vs. College Spending Per Student

div.a: How To Never Do The Things You Hate Ever Again

div.div: Always wanted an assistant to read every Digg story to you but could never afford one? Well now you're in luck. Plus we arranged it so if you use the code "digg" when you sign up you get 25% off.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RSbVOD&via=Digg&text=How To Never Do The Things You Hate Ever Again

div.div: DON'T NEED STREET VIEWS WHERE WE'RE GOING

div.a: Great Movies, As Seen Through Google Street View

div.div: Tre Baker's "Google Street Scene," which imagines scenes from movies as viewed through the eight-eyed orb on top of Google's Street View car.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W2Tjwr&via=Digg&text=Great Movies, As Seen Through Google Street View

div.a: The App That Shows Which Of Your Facebook Friends Are 'Down To Bang'

div.div: “Bang With Friends” supposedly lets you see which of the Facebook friends you'd “bang” would also “bang” you. It's not nearly so discreet as it promises.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WRFU7w&via=Digg&text=The App That Shows Which Of Your Facebook Friends Are 'Down To Bang'

div.div: Keepers and curators at zoo must alternately serve as biologists, psychologists, trainers, chefs, janitors, and educators.

div.a: How Republicans Plan To Rig The Electoral College And Steal The White House

div.div: The GOP is pushing for states to dramatically change the way they allocate electoral votes in a way that would let Republicans win the electoral college while still losing the popular vote much more easily.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11TG6sR&via=Digg&text=How Republicans Plan To Rig The Electoral College And Steal The White House

div.div: Reporting from the Adult Entertainment Expo, where the gun-owning, flip-phone-carrying demo reigns and James Deen just wants to talk about pandas.

div.a: What We Can Expect From A J.J. Abrams 'Star Wars'

div.div: It was one thing when J.J. Abrams took the reins for "Star Trek." But it's a whole other can of space worms with "Star Wars."

div.a: As Cartel Loses Control, Drug Trafficking Is On The Rise

div.div: Perhaps the most dangerous group of narco-assassins in Mexico looks to be reeling a bit from recent setbacks. One of the ironies of the poor health of the Zetas? Drug trafficking across the border is going up.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14ejn9P&via=Digg&text=As Cartel Loses Control, Drug Trafficking Is On The Rise

div.a: Anne Frank Diary iPad App Launched

div.div: The Anne Frank diary app allows users to explore Anne Frank’s world through video interviews, audio clips and archive images 65 years after the much-celebrated book was first published.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10DVchm&via=Digg&text=Anne Frank Diary iPad App Launched

div.div: HOPEFULLY LOOKS WORSE THAN IT TASTES

div.a: A Visual History Of Space Food

div.div: This gallery of freeze dried and preserved morsels spans more than 50 years of NASA space food, from the Gemini missions to the International Space Station.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SI1Rbi&via=Digg&text=A Visual History Of Space Food

div.a: Think Women Haven't Been In Combat Situations Already? The History Of Crossdressing Soldiers

div.div: Meet the women who dressed like men to fight in the Civil War.

div.a: Listen To The Voicemails From Manti Te'o's Fake Girlfriend

div.div: Notre Dame football star Manti Te’o has claimed he is the victim of a cruel hoax after it was revealed that his girlfriend, Lennay Kekua, never existed and that her death was faked.Notre Dame football star Manti Te’o has claimed he is the victim of a cruel hoax after it was revealed that his girlfriend, Lennay Kekua, never existed and that her death was faked. To prove it, he gave Katie Couric copies of voicemails she supposedly left him.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UZGpx5&via=Digg&text=Listen To The Voicemails From Manti Te'o's Fake Girlfriend

div.div: Though history will probably remember Richard Dawkins as the activist who spearheaded a new atheist movement, there is something far more famous and important that he invented — and few people know it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WMLvvS&via=Digg&text=Where Memes Really Come From

div.div: How do you take a flesh-and-bone head and shrink it? A typical Jivaro head-shrinking ritual, as recorded by European explorers in the 19th century, went something like this.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14ewd7Y&via=Digg&text=How Are Shrunken Heads Made?

div.a: This DNA Gun Will Tag Felons For Weeks

div.div: This startlingly orange gun isn't something from a sci-fi film set. Instead, it's a new firearm, from UK-based Selectamark, that fires non-lethal pellets—and marks its targets with DNA for later identification.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y05E2Z&via=Digg&text=This DNA Gun Will Tag Felons For Weeks

div.div: DON'T WORRY ABOUT THE VOICES IN YOUR HEAD

div.a: Silent Reading Isn't So Silent, At Least, Not To Your Brain

div.div: Many people who read silently do so by imagining a voice speaking the words they are reading .

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VpYuEs&via=Digg&text=Silent Reading Isn't So Silent, At Least, Not To Your Brain

div.div: MAYBE WE SHOULD THINK ABOUT GUN REFORM

div.a: Could Bulletproof White Boards Prevent Shooting Deaths?

div.div: The school shootings that took place in Newtown, Conn., in December have provoked a wide range of responses. One business, hoping to prevent another such mass killing, has responded by reinventing the ordinary classroom white board, turning it into a bulletproof shield.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14dvrYT&via=Digg&text=Could Bulletproof White Boards Prevent Shooting Deaths?

div.a: The More Republicans Know About Politics, The More They Believe Conspiracy Theories

div.div: In the mainstream political press, the standard practices of neutrality and balance carry with them an implicit assumption: that Democrats and Republicans are separate but equal in their ideological biases, with each group just as inclined to support its own team and attack the other side. The trouble is, data from psychologists and political scientists suggest that this might be a naive approach.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10B3KWg&via=Digg&text=The More Republicans Know About Politics, The More They Believe Conspiracy Theories

div.a: In Order To Live With People, Canines Evolved To Love Carbs

div.div: THE PROOF IS IN THE POOPING

div.a: All These Objections To Women In Combat Are Dumb

div.div: Serious people won't pay attention to you if your only objection to women serving in combat if you just say, "No sir, I don't like it!" So people with dated ideas about what women can do are forced to invent objections that look at least superficially rooted in fact, instead of sexism. Closer examination reveals they are dumb.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WQVu3n&via=Digg&text=All These Objections To Women In Combat Are Dumb
